meanings.definition: To coat or cover with plaster or mortar.
meanings.sent1: I will parget the wall to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: The builders will parget the house exterior next week.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to parget each other with mud for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to parget even the toughest hearts.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a delicate touch to parget the sculpture with fine details.

meanings.definition: A decorative plasterwork on walls or ceilings.
meanings.sent1: The intricate parget on the ceiling added elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: The historic building showcased beautiful parget designs.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten pawed at the dangling parget, trying to catch it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright parget that lit up the room.
meanings.sent5: The parget displayed a scene of nature, with birds and flowers in vibrant colors.
